seriesJson.title: The glory road
seriesJson.description: The stories of African-Americans who have helped make the United States what it is today.

node.title: Mary McLeod Bethune
node.description: This program focuses on civil rights leader Mary McLeod Bethune.

node.title: James Beckwourth
node.description: This program focuses on explorer and mountain man James Beckwourth.

node.title: Crispus Attucks
node.description: This program focuses on Crispus Attucks, the first casualty of the Boston Massacre in 1770.

node.title: The Colson Family
node.description: This program focuses on the Colson family of Virginia.

node.title: Benjamin Davis, Jr.
node.description: This program focuses on United States Air Force General Benjamin Davis, Jr.

node.title: Martin Luther King, Jr.
node.description: This program focuses on civil rights leader Martin Luther King, Jr.

node.title: A. Philip Randolph
node.description: This program focuses on civil rights leader A. Philip Randolph.

node.title: Matthew Henson
node.description: This program focuses on arctic explorer Matthew Henson.

node.title: Robert Smalls
node.description: This program focuses on ship's captain and politician Robert Smalls.

node.title: Frederick Douglass
node.description: This program focuses on abolitionist Frederick Douglass.

node.title: Phillis Wheatley
node.description: This program focuses on poet Phillis Wheatley.

node.title: Harriet Tubman
node.description: This program focuses on abolitionist Harriet Tubman.

node.title: Jean Baptiste Point du Sable
node.description: This program focuses on Jean Baptiste Point du Sable, known as the "Founder of Chicago."

node.title: Benjamin Banneker
node.description: This program focuses on scientist and surveyor Benjamin Banneker.
